metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5245 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in the Ceph Object Gateway (aka radosgw or RGW) in Ceph before 0.94.4 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via a crafted bucket name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5245` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
ceph-base - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
ceph-common - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
ceph-fuse - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
ceph-mds - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
ceph-mgr - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
ceph-mon - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
ceph-osd - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
ceph-resource-agents - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
ceph-test - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
libcephfs-java - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
libcephfs-jni - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
libcephfs2 - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
librados2 - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
libradosstriper1 - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
librbd1 - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
librgw2 - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python-ceph - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python-cephfs - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python-rados - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python-rbd - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python-rgw - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python3-ceph-argparse - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python3-cephfs - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python3-rados - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python3-rbd - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
python3-rgw - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
radosgw - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
rbd-fuse - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
rbd-mirror - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
rbd-nbd - 10.2.2-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.2.2-0ubuntu5').
